titles.title: Expressing appreciation for the profound dedication and public service of Enrique "Kiki" Camarena on the 25th anniversary of his death.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Mr. Cohen moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1115.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/10/2010--Passed House without amendment. Expresses appreciation for the profound dedication and public service of Enrique "Kiki" Camarena, a special agent of the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) murdered in the line of duty, on the 25th anniversary of his death. Offers sympathy and appreciation to his family, friends, and DEA colleagues. Encourages communities and organizations to commemorate the sacrifice of Special Agent Camarena through the promotion of drug-free communities and participation in drug prevention activities.
